meanings.sent1: The magic trick seemed to mystify the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her complex explanation only served to mystify the students further.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve the riddle only served to mystify him more.
meanings.sent4: The foggy weather seemed to mystify the landscape, hiding its true beauty.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins had a mystical aura that mystified all who visited.

meanings.definition: To make mysterious or difficult to understand.
meanings.sent1: The cryptic message was designed to mystify anyone who read it.
meanings.sent2: The enigmatic smile on her face seemed to mystify those around her.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act never failed to mystify the audience.
meanings.sent4: The intricate plot of the movie mystified even the most attentive viewers.
meanings.sent5: The hidden meaning behind the painting mystified art critics for years.
